Description: The Professional Writing Minor consists of 6 courses. Students must also take the First-Year Writing experience as a prerequisite.
Prerequisite path 1 First-Year Writing:: 76-101 Interpretation and Argument or 76-102 Advanced First-Year Writing*
Prerequisite path 2 First-Year Writing:: 76-106 Writing About Literature, Art, and Culture or/and 76-107 Writing About Data or/and 76-108 Writing About Public Problems
200- or 300-Level Core Courses: 76-26x (Introductory Genre Writing Course in fiction, poetry, nonfiction, or screenwriting) or/and 76-373 Argument or/and 76-389 Rhetorical Grammar or/and 76-390 Style
300- or 400-Level Writing Courses: 76-302   Global Communication Center Practicum (6 units) or/and 76-354   Watchdog Journalism or/and 76-359   User Experience Methods for Documents or/and 76-360   Literary Journalism Workshop or/and 76-372   News Writing or/and 76-378   Literacy: Educational Theory and Community Practice or/and 76-389   Rhetorical Grammar or/and 76-391   Document & Information Design or/and 76-395   Science Writing or/and 76-396   Non-Profit Message Creation or/and 76-415   Mediated Power and Propaganda or/and 76-425   Science in the Public Sphere or/and 76-474   Software Documentation or/and 76-476   Rhetoric of Science or/and 76-481   Introduction to Multimedia Design (12 units) or/and 76-487   Web Design (12 units) or/and 76-491   Rhetorical Analysis or/and 76-494   Healthcare Communications
200-Level or Above English Elective: Please consult the list of courses published each semester by the Department for current offerings. In choosing English Electives, students are encouraged to sample courses from across the Department.
Notes: Students need to take at most 6 courses worth 54 units in total. Student shave to take either of the two pre-requisite paths. In path one they have to only take one of the two offered courses, while in the second path, students have to take two courses out of three offered. In professional writing requirement, students only need to take 1 course in total. Students need to take two courses in total from the combination of 76-2xx or 76-3xx. Same exact case with 76-300 or 76-400 level course. In the end, one last 76-2xx or above elective should be taken to complete all 6 courses.
